entry.title: The inside story of why Amazon bought PillPack in its effort to crack the $500 billion prescription market
entry.quote: PillPack is just a piece of Amazon’s expansive plan to uproot the $3 trillion U.S. health-care industry. The company is also working with J.P. Morgan Chase and Berkshire Hathaway on a joint venture called Haven aiming to improve care and bring down the costs.

entry.title: How AI could save lives without spilling medical secrets
entry.quote: Oasis stores the private patient data on a secure chip, designed in collaboration with other researchers at Berkeley. The data remains within the Oasis cloud; outsiders are able to run algorithms on the data, and receive the results, without its ever leaving the system. A smart contract—software that runs on top of a blockchain—is triggered when a request to access the data is received. This software logs how the data was used and also checks to make sure the machine-learning computation was carried out correctly.

entry.title: What is a Neural Network?
entry.quote: YouTube Series on the basics of neural networks and deep learning

entry.title: Stanford University: Illustrated Machine Learning Cheatsheets
entry.quote: A set of illustrated Machine Learning cheatsheets covering the content of the CS 229 class, which I TA-ed in Fall 2018 at Stanford. They can (hopefully!) be useful to all future students of this course as well as to anyone else interested in Machine Learning.

entry.title: A new way to build tiny neural networks could create powerful AI on your phone
entry.quote: We’ve been wasting our processing power to train neural networks that are ten times too big.

entry.title: People + AI Guidebook
entry.quote: This Guidebook will help you build human-centered AI products. It’ll enable you to avoid common mistakes, design excellent experiences, and focus on people as you build AI-driven applications.
